data: John Smith Product Owner Senior Software Engineer at Lockheed Martin Doylestown, Pennsylvania, United States Join Prog.AI to see contacts Join Prog.AI to see contacts Summary ðŸ‘¤ Senior ðŸŽ“ Top School John Smith is a Product Owner and Senior Software Engineer at Lockheed Martin with seven years of full-time software development experience across C++, Python, Java, and JavaScript/TypeScript. In his current role, he standardizes test-driven C++ development to accelerate integration of SAR algorithms, leads multi-input and image quality SAR feature work, and mentors junior engineers, occasionally acting as Scrum Master. He has hands-on experience deploying Python services with Docker and Kubernetes, using AWS S3 for data management, and aligning front-end React GUIs with C++ backends. John recently earned an MS in Computer and Information Science from the University of Pennsylvania, after earning a BS in Computer Engineering from Penn State, and he is based in Doylestown, PA. His work uniquely blends research-driven ML/AI integration with production-grade software delivery, demonstrating both algorithmic depth and practical system engineering. 7 years of coding experience 4 years of employment as a software developer Bachelor of Science - BS, Computer Engineering, Alumni, Bachelor of Science - BS, Computer Engineering, Alumni at Penn State University Scholars Diploma, Scholars Diploma at Central Bucks HS-West Master of Computer and Information Science - MCIS, Computer Science, Master of Computer and Information Science - MCIS, Computer Science at University of Pennsylvania Stackoverflow Stats 11 reputation 620 reached 0 answers 1 question Github Skills ( 20 ) vscode-extension 10 vs-code 10 c-extension 10 microsoft 9 typescript 9 vscode 9 cpp 9 electron 7 editor 7 pip 6 raspberry-pi 6 mitmproxy 6 visual-studio 6 cryptography 6 python 6 5 more skills Programming languages ( 3 ) TypeScript Java Swift Github contributions (5) More johnwsmithv/Programming-Projects Jan 2020 - May 2022 This is a combination of all of the programming projects that I'm currently working on!
